intro: Silene caesia subsp. samothracica, commonly known as the Samothracean campion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers have five petals that are often reflexed at the tips. This subspecies is native to the Greek island of Samothraki and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphological features.
